It was announced on 18 October, 2011 in New York City. The DROID RAZR by Motorola is the thinnest smartphone in the world at only 7.1 mm thick at its thinnest point (it does, however, have a "bump" on top that's approximately 11.1 mm thick.) and includes a 4.3 inch Super [[Active-matrix OLED|AMOLED]] Advanced display, covered in a [[Gorilla glass]] screen and a [[Kevlar]] back plate. It is powered by an [[Texas Instruments OMAP#OMAP 4|OMAP 4430]] [[system-on-chip|SoC]] with dual 1.2 GHz [[ARM Cortex-A9 MPCore|ARM Cortex-A9]] processor cores. Its 8 megapixel rear facing camera can record 1080p HD videos. It comes with 1 GB of RAM and runs version 2.3.5 of the Android OS.{{cite web |url= http://mobilesmug.com/news/1-phones/1116-motorola-droid-razr-finally-unveiled-making-its-way-to-rogers-and-verizon|title= Motorola DROID RAZR finally unveiled, making its way to Rogers and Verizon|date= 19 October 2011|publisher= MobileSmug|accessdate=19 October 2011 }} ==Availability== The phone launched in the United States on November 11th, 2011 at 11:11AMhttp://www.engadget.com/2011/11/07/verizon-confirms-razrs-launch-date-november-11th-at-11-11am/ [[GSM]]/[[Universal Mobile Telecommunications System|UMTS]] version Motorola RAZR XT910 was launched in India on 21 November, 2011 at an MRP of {{INR}} 35,990.
